title: Demi Lovato apologizes for 'offending anyone' after 'spiritual' trip to Israel
text:
Pop singer Demi Lovato apologized Thursday for “offending anyone” after her trip to Israel where she was baptized in the Jordan River was perceived as a political statement endorsing the Jewish nation.

“I’m extremely frustrated,” Ms. Lovato wrote on Instagram. “I accepted a free trip to Israel in exchange for a few posts. No one told me there would be anything wrong with going or that I could possibly be offending anyone. With that being said, I’m sorry if I’ve hurt or offended anyone, that was not my intention.

“Sometimes people present you with opportunities and no one tells you the potential backlash you could face in return,” she continued. “This was meant to be a spiritual experience for me, NOT A POLITICAL STATEMENT and now I realize it hurt people and for that I’m sorry. Sorry I’m not more educated, and sorry for thinking this trip was just a spiritual experience.”

Ms. Lovato had shared several photos on Instagram from her trip to Israel this week, where she was baptized and also visited the Western Wall, the Yad Vashem Holocaust memorial, and the Shalva National Center, where she was photographed holding a little girl with special needs.

“Spirituality is so important to me…to be baptized in the Jordan river – the same place Jesus was baptized – I’ve never felt more renewed in my life,” the singer wrote Tuesday. “This trip has been so important for my well-being, my heart, and my soul. I’m grateful for the memories made and the opportunity to be able to fill the God-sized hole in my heart. Thank you for having me, Israel.”

The posts, which no longer allow for commenting, apparently garnered criticism from pro-Palestinian activists and those who oppose the Israeli government.
